item.title: Thoughts on Windows 8
item.author: codecraig@gmail.com (Craig Wickesser)
item.description: My son received a laptop, his first, for Christmas. It’s an ASUS running Windows 8. To date, he’s only used Apple laptops, iPad, iPhone Touch and Galaxy S3/4/5 Android phones at home. I helped setup the laptop and the first thing I noticed was the “app” centric user interface. I noticed he seemed to be able to navigate around rather easily and wasn’t getting lost. The “app” centric focus of the operating system is compelling and I believe a win for Microsoft in terms of aligning with the younger generation.
